description: This section demonstrates content that has a moderate number of accessibility failures. The failures present a mix of those that can be found through automated testing and those that require manual testing.

This section includes only the [All] Colections page, demonstrating content that has a moderate-to-high number of accessibility failures, some of which would be very difficult to work around. The failures present a mix of those that can be found through automated testing and those that require manual testing.
discussionItems: Should emojis that are used as part of a span o text be hidden from assistive technology or have a suitable accessible name to aid in comprehension?
Is wrapping an animation in a prefers-reduced-motion media query sufficient for automatically animated content?

description: This section includes the containers collection page and related item subpages, demonstrating content that a number of small accessibility failures.

includes the dishes collection page and related item subpages, demonstrating content that has very few accessibility failures, where the failures that exist can be worked around or are in less-important features. The failures present a mix of those that can be found through automated testing and those that require manual testing.
This section includes the glass collection page and related item subpages.
This section demonstrates content that has few accessibility failures, BUT the failures that exist could cause individuals with disabilities physical or psychological harm.

This section includes the technology collection page and related item subpages, demonstrating content that has very few accessibility failures in the programmatic portion of the page but has a number of failures in the content.
This section demonstrates issues with focus management, accessible names, incompletely implement controls for user interface components with ARIA roles, reading order, and Windows high-contrast mode.
discussionItems: Is misusing CSS forced colors something that WCAG 3 needs to address?
Do WCAG 3's Adjust Color and/or AT Control have the same coverage as Section 508's and EN 301 549's User Preference requirement?

description: This section includes the Blog page and related article subpages, demonstrating a moderate level of content, interaction and multimedia failures.
discussionItems: In the post titled 'Announcing the Addition of a New Wing', there is a pull quote from the subsequent paragraph, which appears two sentences later in the article. Should the pull quote be hidden from screen readers?

description: This section includes the Gift shop, product subpages and checkout process, demonstrating task completion and form-based failures. Note that at least one item must be in the cart to continue the checkout process.
This section includes the registration and sign in processes, demonstrating failures related to task completion, forms, and authentication.
This section includes the Take a Tour page and related subpages, demonstrating task completion and multimedia failures.
This section includes the volunteer sign up process pages, including a small number of task completion and form-based failures.
